Class InputHandler

java.lang.Object
handlers.models.InputHandler
public class InputHandler extends Object
The InputHandler Class is responsible for handling the input, provided by the user. It is used to handle commands for the program state, file system and gameplay.

  • Field Details

    • consoleReader

      private BufferedReader consoleReader
      The reader, that fetched user input from the system's default input stream. The reader is essential part of the class, and it is set up automatically upon creating an object of this class.

    • fileHandler

      private FileHandler fileHandler
      The file handler is responsible for the basic functionality, while handling the file system.

    • isProgramActive

      private boolean isProgramActive
      Shows if the program is active, while executing commands. Used for the main loop for receiving and executing user input.

    • administrativeMode

      private boolean administrativeMode
      Shows if the program is in administrative mode. This mode unlocks certain functionalities of the program.

    • parameterizedCommands

      private Map<String,Consumer<String>> parameterizedCommands
      Holds general commands that require parameters. The key represent the name of the command. The values are the commands, that will be executed, when being called.

    • nonParameterizedCommands

      private Map<String,Runnable> nonParameterizedCommands
      Holds general commands that does not require parameters. The key represent the name of the command. The values are the commands, that will be executed, when being called.

    • game

      private GameProcessor game
      An instance of the game. Upon starting the program, the field is null. Starting a new game or reading a save file, sets a game instance to the field, that can be later played.

    • newlyLoadedGame

      private GameProcessor newlyLoadedGame
      A newly loaded instance of the game. If a game is already active, when the new game instance is created, the game will be temporarily stored here.

  • Constructor Details

    • InputHandler

      public InputHandler(FileHandler fileHandler)
      Constructs a InputHandler instance with the given instance of a file handler.
      Parameters:
      fileHandler - Handler that will be used for handling files

  • Method Details

    • startProgram

      public void startProgram() throws Exception
      Starts the program and the main loop. While the program is active, the method checks if a game instance is presents and starts the game logic. If a game instance is not set, the method calls the handleCommand method, that carries out the general commands of the program.
      Throws:
      Exception - when other exceptions have been thrown from the command handling or game logic
      See Also:
      • handleCommand()

    • handleCommand

      public String[] handleCommand() throws IOException
      Handles all the commands of the program. If a general command is detected, it is carried out in this method. If a game command is called, the method prepares a string array with the command name and given parameters.
      Returns:
      A string array, needed for calling game commands or null, if the input calls for a general command
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs with reading the user input

    • saveAs

      private void saveAs(String fileLocation)
      Calls the fileHandler's FileHandler.saveAsFile(File, GameProcessor) method for saving loaded game instance in a targeted file. If a file is not opened or a game is not loaded, the method shows an appropriate message on the system's default output stream.
      Parameters:
      fileLocation - File location of the file, that will be used for saving a loaded game instance

    • save

      private void save()
      Calls the fileHandler's FileHandler.saveFile(GameProcessor) method for saving loaded game instance in the currently loaded file. If a file is not opened or a game is not loaded, the method shows an appropriate message on the system's default output stream.

    • setAdministrativeMode

      private void setAdministrativeMode()
      Switches between normal and administrative mode of th program If a file is not opened, the method shows an appropriate message on the system's default output stream.

    • isAdministrativeMode

      public boolean isAdministrativeMode()
      Shows if the program is in administrative mode.
      Returns:
      Boolean representing if administrative mode is active.

    • open

      private void open(String fileLocation)
      Calls the fileHandler's FileHandler.readFile(File) method for loading the targeted file. If the file handler reads a saved game, the game instance is loaded into the program.
      Parameters:
      fileLocation - File location of the file, that will be read from

    • newGame

      private void newGame(String mode)
      Creates a new game instance. Depending on the mode, the method will create a normal or random instance of the game. The random instance is only accessible when in administrative mode. If a file is not opened, the method shows an appropriate message on the system's default output stream.
      Parameters:
      mode - The game type, that decides what instance of the game needs to be created

    • close

      private void close()
      Calls the fileHandler's FileHandler.closeFile() method for closing the currently loaded file. When the loaded file is successfully closed, the loaded game instance is flushed. If the file handler reads a saved game, the game instance is loaded into the program.

    • isGameActive

      public boolean isGameActive()
      Shows if the game is still active.
      Returns:
      Boolean that represents if the game is active

    • exit

      private void exit()
      Exits the program. The loaded game instance is flushed and the main loop for checking for loaded game instances and incoming user input is stopped. After stopping the loop, the program exits.

    • help

      private void help()
      Shows all supported general commands on the system's default output stream.
